page.title: 11Woodlands in Leighfield 1
page.content: Priors Coppice (833055) is 68 acres of ancient coppice woodland split between the two Rutland parishes of Brooke and Leighfield. The two parts have a different recent history of ownership and management. The western two thirds is ash and field maple coppice regenerating naturally after felling with the ash now at 40 ft in height. The eastern third is mature ash and field maple with a stand of wychelm and a scatter of planted hybrid black poplar.The rich ground flora includes herbparis, wood speedwell and yellow archangel.It is one of only two places in Leicestershire where the rare large slug, characteristic of ancient woods, Limax cinereoniger has been found.In 1973 the wood was notified by the Nature Conservancy Council as a Site of Special Scientific Interest.
